basics.name: Rob Valentine
basics.label: Software QA/CICD Manager
basics.summary: Experienced System Designer with a demonstrated history of working in the information technology and services industry. Skilled in C#, ASP.Net, React, PHP, Databases, Team Building, Web Design, and Proposal Writing. Strong engineering professional with a National Diploma focused in Information Technology from Port Elizabeth Technikon.

work.name: Oracle
work.location: East London, Eastern Cape, South Africa

work.name: Deloitte Consulting
work.position: Lead Developer: EMIS EC Upload Tool
work.summary:
Following on from EMISTools, the EMIS EC Upload Tool processes SASAMS databases from the province's schools. At 5612 schools, this translates to approximately 561GB of data in the form of MS Access databases.

The EMIS EC Upload tool processes these databases as efficiently and quickly as possible - reaching speeds of around 1000 databases a day. Data is pumped into a SQL Warehouse for further analysis with each Quarterly warehouse reaching sizes of approx. 1.2TB.

The system is (currently) written using C# and makes heavy use of parallel processing, scaled bulk insert and efficient error reporting (in a friendly way).

work.name: Deloitte Consulting
work.summary:
EMISTools.co.za processes monthly SASAMS submissions from 5612 schools around the Eastern Cape. 

I was responsible for developing this as an independent contractor for Deloitte Consulting in East London and for the Eastern Cape Department of Education. I have since joined Deloitte in a development position and am continually improving the system.

The system is (currently) written in ASP.net and leverages agile methodology and a lot of optimisation.

work.name: DomainCheap
work.summary:
Responsible for managing, planning and overseeing implementation of Web Hosting technology including server monitoring, WHMCS, Billing and custom integration with South African service providers such as Domains.co.za and Uniforum.

Domaincheap was sold to WebAfrica in its entirety in August 2015 along with ~2500 clients and ~ 5000 domains.

projects.name: National Procurement Portal
projects.summary:
The Procurement Portal focuses on disseminating information on tender opportunities and Requests for Quotations countrywide and in the future, will also cater for electronic submission of such quotations through the National Procurement Portal.

Daily leads and tenders are gathered, captured and categorized correctly on the platform to make it accessible to SMME's. SMME's who are registered on the site can view available tenders and can even receive alerts when appropriate information becomes available.

The Procurement Portal is partnership between Metropolitan Life, Ubuntu Empowerment Services and the Small Enterprise Development Agency.

projects.name: Protect The Wild
projects.summary: Protect the Wild is an ongoing project to generate funds for wildlife sanctuaries via online game playing and advertising revenue.

projects.name: Gift Or Take
projects.summary: Receiving a gift is always exciting, no matter whether it’s for your birthday, for a holiday, or for no reason at all. A gift can brighten your whole day! Imagine knowing that anytime you collect your mail you might find a letter, a postcard, or a package from someone you’ve never met, who simply wants you to have a good day. That’s what Gift or Take is about.
